channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15425] Failing to write bulk load event marker in the WAL is ignored
item.description: During LoadIncrementalHFiles process if we fail to write the bulk load event marker in the WAL, it is ignored. So this will lead to data mismatch issue in source and peer cluster in case of bulk loaded data replication scenario.
item.summary: Failing to write bulk load event marker in the WAL is ignored

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: I think the same problem may come up with timeline-consistent region replicas also.
So writing some other markers, fail also just ignored? Which all?
Last time when I checked all others looked ok.

What is the specific reason for the WAL markers to be igonored? Suppose a region open marker is ignored due to exception what happens on Log replay?
How is the flush marker getting reused from the WAL? I have not seen this code fully to know the full behaviour.

What is the specific reason for the WAL markers to be igonored?

I think it is a bug. We should fix it.

Suppose a region open marker is ignored due to exception what happens on Log replay?
How is the flush marker getting reused from the WAL?

I need to check code fully before I comment anything about them. But these can be done later also I think, not as part of this jira.

With this patch fix there will be a behavior change in the response of LoadIncrementalHFiles tool. Earlier if we failed to write bulk load event in the wal we returned as success but now it will not be. I think this should be OK and acceptable.

Please review.

-1 overall

lgtm


5300	    boolean success = false;

success gives people impression that the outcome is a success.

Please rename it to isSuccessful.

I guess it would be difficult to write a test for this scenario.

Thanks for the comment.

I guess it would be difficult to write a test for this scenario.

I thought a lot but could not find a easy way.

But these can be done later also I think, not as part of this jira.

Yes another JIRA is best. But better to see the impact.

// Have to abort region server because some hfiles has been loaded but we can't write

            // the event into WAL

            this.rsServices.abort("Failed to write bulk load event into WAL.", ioe);

The RS itself is aborting. So how will you make use of your return result now?
+1, assuming tests pass.

This message was automatically generated.

Flush and bulk load markers have been added for region replicas so that they can replay these events. Normally, the regular log split / replay ignores these markers. For region replicas, missing a flush file or bulk load files is not a critical condition (since eventually they will be picked up due to compactions), so we were following the safe route there.

Now, returning failure will cause the bulk load RPC to be retried, and the regionserver would have already bulk loaded those files, so they will be bulk loaded again. One cluster will see 2 sets of bulk load files, the other cluster which gets replication will see only one set. There is no atomic transaction to make sure that the bulk load and WAL event happens atomically, so it is a best effort in that case. Semantically it should still be correct though.

Patch looks fine to me.

BulkLoad tests passed.

Let me commit to master branch first.

For region replicas, missing a flush file or bulk load files is not a critical condition (since eventually they will be picked up due to compactions)

Regarding the bulk load markers, that is not for Region replicas.. It is for replication across cluster. These wal marker cells also will be passed via the Replication path and the sink cluster will read the cell and do load the file there also.. So a miss in writing this cell to WAL while bulk load will result in all these bulk loaded data not getting available for peer cluster. (And no time later also it can get available)

But ya what ur point of retry and loading the file again ! Need to see any impact. So these 2 files will have diff seqIds?
If the bulk loaded file is loaded again and this time the WAL marker is added only the latest file that got retried is going to be replicated in the peer cluster? Ya the seqId does matter here.

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-Trunk_matrix #768 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-Trunk_matrix/768/)
HBASE-15425 Failing to write bulk load event marker in the WAL is (tedyu: rev d14b6c3810f193adb658a4052aca9c3c23d74ae9)

  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/HRegion.java

Thanks all for the comments.

I think same hfile with different seq ids will not cause any impact as in case of bulk loaded data replication we copy these source hfiles to peer cluster and then almost run this bulk load tool again, so it will generate a new hfile as the per seq id in peer cluster. HFiles with different seq ids should also not impact as the data in both these hfiles are same, so it will not create any difference.

Thanks for the patch, Ashish.

Thanks for the reviews.
When the RS itself is aborting, how is that the return result will get used? Should you avoid the RS from getting aborted?

Actually that abort is a graceful shutdown. In our setup what we have seen is, client is able to get the response and the RS is getting shut down. But yes it is possible that before the client get response RS can get aborted.

Should you avoid the RS from getting aborted?

Yes, I was thinking on that as well, that RS abort is not really required when WAL append is failing. But wanted to check all the scenarios around it before raising a jira. I will raise one tomorrow(IST) and address that.

But yes it is possible that before the client get response RS can get aborted.

Exactly. Better to have addressed that in this JIRA. But as it is committed please do it in a new JIRA. No problem.
